title: Bill Turnbull rushes off for cancer treatment after This Morning appearance
text:
He admitted to the hosts how he copes living with his cancer (Picture: ITV)

Bill Turnbull has opened up about his cancer diagnosis in an interview on This Morning before revealing he was heading for chemotherapy treatment straight after.

The BBC host who is battling prostate cancer spoke to Holly Willoughby and Philip Schofield on how he has coped since he was diagnosed two years ago and he admitted that he tries to stay ‘positive’.

He explained: ‘I am in no pain and no discomfort at the moment but I have changed the way I live.

‘I can be weepy from time to time but 85% of the time I feel great. Western medicine has great benefits and I am going straight to the hospital after this to have another round of treatment.’

Bill also revealed that he believes that we can ‘heal ourselves from within’.

Holly Willoughby and Philip Schofield (Picture: ITV)

He added: ‘This illness is part of me so it’s all about from the moment you wake up to try and think positively and try to say “it’s a lovely day outside” even if it’s not.

‘We live in a fantastic world and there are days when that is not my attitude but I try to keep smiling.’

The 63-year-old broadcaster admits to trying CBD oil as well as having his hospital treatment.

‘I have taken Cannabis oil and I know there are been lots of evidence of people that have healed from cancer taking it, but the difficulty is knowing how much to take.

‘I take CBD oil every day and I find it’s very helpful.’

This Morning airs weekdays at 10.30am on ITV.
